comments:
Eclipse 20020412-I

1)Load org.eclipse.swt into workspace.
2)Copy .classpath_win32 to .classpath
3)Make sure org.eclipse.swt is recompiled.
4)Open type CTabFolder and put a breakpoint at CTabFolder.setSelection(int)
5)Debug Eclipse within Eclipse.
6) When you hit the setSelection breakpoint, expand "this" in the Variables 
view and then hit run.
7)After the second time you hit the breakpoint and expand "this" when you hit 
run you get the following walkback:

java.lang.NullPointerException
	at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Menu.getItems(Menu.java:383)
	at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Menu.releaseWidget(Menu.java:637)
	at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.MenuItem.releaseWidget(MenuItem.java:386)
	at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Menu.releaseWidget(Menu.java:640)
	at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Decorations.releaseWidget
(Decorations.java:631)
	at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Shell.releaseWidget(Shell.java:599)
	at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Widget.dispose(Widget.java:355)
	at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Shell.dispose(Shell.java:405)
	at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Display.release(Display.java:1262)
	at org.eclipse.swt.graphics.Device.dispose(Device.java:198)
	at org.eclipse.ui.internal.Workbench.run(Workbench.java:824)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.boot.InternalBootLoader.run
(InternalBootLoader.java:777)
	at org.eclipse.core.boot.BootLoader.run(BootLoader.java:319)
	at EclipseRuntimeLauncher.main(EclipseRuntimeLauncher.java:14)
java.util.MissingResourceException: Can't find bundle for base name 
java.text.resources.DateFormatZoneData, locale en_US
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.boot.PlatformConfiguration.save
(PlatformConfiguration.java:1006)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.boot.PlatformConfiguration.save
(PlatformConfiguration.java:977)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.boot.PlatformConfiguration.shutdown
(PlatformConfiguration.java:1136)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.boot.InternalBootLoader.shutdown
(InternalBootLoader.java:867)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.boot.InternalBootLoader.run
(InternalBootLoader.java:782)
	at org.eclipse.core.boot.BootLoader.run(BootLoader.java:319)
	at EclipseRuntimeLauncher.main(EclipseRuntimeLauncher.java:14)
	at EclipseRuntimeLauncher.main(EclipseRuntimeLauncher.java:14)
Exception in thread "main"

8) Sometimes I don't get this walkback but instead I get the attached javacore.

Could not reproduce the problem on Sun 1.4.1 or IBM  J2RE 1.3.0 IBM build cn130-
20010925. Can you try a different VM to see if the problem exists there?

One stack trace indicates a problem in swt.widgets.Menu, and the other in 
org.eclipse.ui.PartPane. Veronika, is this still a problem? (It does not look 
lie the debugger's fault - I suggest to move to SWT or platform UI).
Just tried it again in Eclipse F1 and got the attached javacore.

Created an attachment (id=1030)
Eclipse F1 javacore

Previous attempts were with IBM build cn130-20010925.

Now trying with Sun build 1.3.0_04.

Running Eclipse in eclipse runs fine.
Debugigng eclipse in eclispe fails:

Get console message:
Java HotSpot(TM) Client VM warning: Setting of property "java.compiler" is 
ignored

Get log entry:
!ENTRY org.eclipse.jdt.debug 4 120 May 24, 2002 10:28:22.101
!MESSAGE Internal error logged from JDI Debug: 
!STACK 0
org.eclipse.jdi.TimeoutException
	at org.eclipse.jdi.internal.connect.PacketReceiveManager.getReply
(PacketReceiveManager.java:127)
	at org.eclipse.jdi.internal.connect.PacketReceiveManager.getReply
(PacketReceiveManager.java:137)
	at org.eclipse.jdi.internal.MirrorImpl.requestVM(MirrorImpl.java:168)
	at org.eclipse.jdi.internal.MirrorImpl.requestVM(MirrorImpl.java:186)
	at org.eclipse.jdi.internal.ClassTypeImpl.newInstance
(ClassTypeImpl.java:294)
	at 
org.eclipse.jdt.internal.debug.core.model.JDIDebugTarget$ThreadTerminator.handle
Event(JDIDebugTarget.java:1645)
	at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.debug.core.EventDispatcher.dispatch
(EventDispatcher.java:129)
	at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.debug.core.EventDispatcher.run
(EventDispatcher.java:202)
	at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:484)

I have just repeated this scenario 4 times with IBM build cn130-20010925 and 
got three different javacore variations.  I do not think the javacore points to 
the problem.  I think something like a memory corruption problem is occuring 
which causes a failure shortly thereafter.

Note, there are problems with Sun 1.3.0. Does the problem occurr on 1.3.1_01 or 
1.3.1_03?
Just tried with IBM cn131-20020403 and the problem did not occur.

Just tried with Sun 1.3.1_01 and problem did not occur.

Looks like a problem with cn130-20010925 only.
Closing PR since this is a known VM problem.
